snippet: The military has removed dietary supplements containing the ingredient dimethylamylamine from stores on its bases, though the products are widely available elsewhere in the country.
abstract: United States Army is investigating whether certain dietary supplements for athletes, which it has pulled from stores on its bases, may have played a role in the 2011 deaths of two soldiers; products are widely available elsewhere in the country.

byline.original: By PETER LATTMAN and NATASHA SINGER

lead_paragraph: The military has removed dietary supplements containing the ingredient dimethylamylamine from stores on its bases, though the products are widely available elsewhere in the country.

headline.seo: Army Studies Workout Supplements After 2 Deaths
headline.main: Army Studies Workout Supplements After Deaths
headline.print_headline: Army Studies Workout Supplements After Deaths

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
